channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2023080591
item.description:
Report X-2023080591

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet box brought to QA. DescribePack: 4-1 gallon plastic bottles were packed upside down in the box. 1 of the lids was loose and spilled some liquid in the box and on the other bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Lids were tightened.

item.title: Report X-2023080971
item.description:
Report X-2023080971

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED CALL ABOUT HAZMAT LEAKER. RESPONDER USED PPE AND DECISSION TREE AND RESPONDED TO CALL. RESPONDER CONTAINED PACKAGE AND BROUGHT BACK TO THE CAGE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023080566
item.description:
Report X-2023080566

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the top/side of the box was wet. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the box was set in a hazmat tote, taken to the damage hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report E-2023080136
item.description:
Report E-2023080136

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: FREELAND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG West, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG West, LLC driver inadvertently opened a valve on the trailer prior to having the delivery hose connected to the storage tank. This allowed approximately 40 gallons of gasoline to be released. Graymar Environmental responded to the site and handled the remediation.
